text: I'm appalled and sickened that people
should lose their lives in this way and
I thought so very much with the the
families and friends of the of the
victims today I've obviously talked to
the Chief Constable of Thames Valley
Police thanked him and his officers for
their bravery in tackling the the
suspect we now have someone in in
custody the policeman's get on with
their their job get to the bottom of
exactly what happened and so it'd be
difficult really to comment in detail
except to say this that if there are
lessons that we need to learn about how
we handle such cases how we handle the
events leading up to such cases then we
will learn those lessons and we will not
hesitate to take action when necessary I
see no reason to draw that conclusion
but I do think that clearly you know if
there are lessons to be learned from
this particular case we will learn them
as it happens crime overall has been has
been coming down and I'm very pleased
that we've got large numbers of officers
out on the streets now we've got as you
know we're recruiting 20,000 more and of
those I think we've already got about
three and a half thousand in the force
so in the police service that's that's
good but there's a way to go
